p: A. argyi essential oils were extracted with hydrodistillation, subcritical extraction and SDE respectively. Their extraction time, yields and colors were evaluated. As shown in Table 1, SDE took the shortest time (180 min) and gave the highest yield (1.2%), followed by subcritical extraction (1%) and hydrodistillation (0.5%). The yields of these extracted oils were higher than the reported ones, which were around 0.20% to 0.26% [ 15]. Furthermore, SDE cost 1 h less than hydrodistillation, and 2 h less than subcritical extraction. Compared with the other studies, SDE is a feasible method which offers yield and processing time advantages.
